Articles.Content: Just wanted to take a second to say thank you to the mods for KSP. After dealing with the mods on facepunch I can now see in vivid detail just how awesome and fair you guys are. Thank you.

Yeah - they are ok.

Just kidding, more than ok, they are awesome.

(opinion subject to rapid change in event of personal thread being locked or moved)
Yeah, and compared to some game server admins/mods, they're completely different. Far better.
The awesome mods, along with the generally awesome community, makes the KSP forum a nice place to be. I don't believe I have ever seen anyone start yelling swears at each other here.

Ksp Forums are the first forums for which I've actually signed up (~2 years ago, got caught in the April Unplanned Forum Disassembly).

Compared to other forums where I had lurked before, this place felt civil, fun and full of people willing to share and discuss.

Maybe it has to do with the audience (people who enjoy designing rockets and sending little green men to space), but in my limited experience, I've also seen forums full of interesting stuff and people that were basically unreadable because of the lack of 'etiquette' (long chains of reaction pictures that dilute the information density of the thread or noob-bashing for example).

So yeah, I think we can thank the mods for their hard work at keeping this place nice and the community for playing the rules and being civil enough.

Edited January 16, 2014 by el_coyoto

Shoot. Now you've done it. You've introduced an error in the system. I'm stuck as to whether to keep this here (where it does belong), or move it to the Forum Forum (where it also pretty much belongs).

Thank y'all kindly, though I'm sure you've got to give more thanks to my predecessors than myself, who's only been a mod for a little while yet. But yeah, I've been on forums where the moderation is haphazard, careless, vindictive, and often very totalitarian, if not downright playing favourites as well. Not fun, not fun at all...
Yeah, the mods of the KSP forums keep calm under most situations and are friendly to everyone, just like a mod has to be.

I have to agree with everyone above me, the KSP community is the best I have ever seen (and thankfully it hasn't been diluted by the move to steam) and I'm sure the great mods are an important part in that. Thank you mods!
I admire how well the mods on here handle things when the forums set on fire as they do occasionally.

Ksp Forums are the first forums for which I've actually signed up (~2 years ago, got caught in the April Unplanned Forum Disassembly).

Compared to other forums where I had lurked before, this place felt civil, fun and full of people willing to share and discuss.

Maybe it has to do with the audience (people who enjoy designing rockets and sending little green men to space), but in my limited experience, I've also seen forums full of interesting stuff and people that were basically unreadable because of the lack of 'etiquette' (long chains of reaction pictures that dilute the information density of the thread or noob-bashing for example).

So yeah, I think we can thank the mods for their hard work at keeping this place nice and the community for playing the rules and being civil enough.

same here got lost in April and has been one of the best to lurk on all sorts of useful info
